resources.string: Enter bitrate in kilobits per second (e.g., 1500)
Enter max pixels for long edge (e.g., 1280)

H.265/HEVC codec is more efficient and produces better quality and/or smaller file size than H.264/AVC. However it is not as well supported as H.264/AVC so select H.264/AVC if you want maximum compatibility.
Auto bitrate set to %1$d kbps for %2$dpx (%3$s)
Selecting streamable will create a "fast-start" video which has meta-data moved to the start so it can start streaming faster.
Bitrate too low. Minimum is %1$d kbps. Using %1$d kbps.
Bitrate too high. Maximum is %1$d kbps. Using %1$d kbps.
H.265 not supported on this device. Using H.264 instead.
Video not saved. Compressed file (%1$s) is larger than original (%2$s).
